title: Introducción a Julia
text:
TipUTF8 Column Names



As many machine learning models do not work properly with arbitrary UTF8 names, mlr3 defaults to throwing an error if any of the column names passed to r ref("as_task_regr()") (and other task constructors) contain a non-ASCII character or do not comply with R’s variable naming scheme. Therefore, we recommend converting names with r ref("make.names()") if possible. You can bypass this check by setting options(mlr3.allow_utf8_names = TRUE) (but do not be surprised if errors occur later, especially when passing objects to other packages).

title: Clase 1
text:
NoneExercise: Character or Number?



Can you spot the difference between a character string and a number? Here’s a test: Which of these are character strings and which are numbers? 1, "1", "one".
